State College will meet the Old West tomorrow when a new barbecue restaurant opens PERIOD

 said Andy Zangrilli owner of Beulahs BarBQue and Bar Bleu  S PERIOD Garner St PERIOD

There will be an openair kitchen and a bar in the center of the room PERIOD

The restaurant replaces Mario and Luigis which Zangrilli also owned PERIOD

Beulahs is decorated in an  he said PERIOD

The conversion of the old restaurant was undertaken because Midwesternstyle barbecues are becoming more popular Zangrilli said PERIOD

The upstairs Beulahs BarBQue will be 

The downstairs of the establishment Bar Bleu will be a little more upscale and will feature musical performers Zangrilli said PERIOD

After  p.m. mostly smaller acoustic bands will play rock n roll folk and jazz PERIOD

The downstairs seating can accommodate about  people PERIOD

The opening of this new restaurant will bring some added competition to downtown State College among restaurants said managers of restaurants near Beulahs PERIOD

 said Rick Zendrosky manager of Babys Burgers  Shakes  S PERIOD Garner St PERIOD

There are so many restaurants downtown that this new addition should not hurt business he added PERIOD

 said Eric Miller manager of the Lions Den  S PERIOD Garner St PERIOD

Miller said any business that will draw people to the east end of downtown will be good PERIOD
